Data: What kind of samples will you use to generate microscopy images and genetic sequence data? Please add these in the table, these are considered physical data in the context of a DMP, how will you manage these, do you need special storage, will you share them? 
Storage: Please note that storing data on PCs and external hard drives is not very secure, please have a look at the storage guide for KU Leuven recommended solutions: https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en
Preservation: Please note that the KU Leuven RDM policy asks to preserve all relevant data for 10 years, see https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/policy
Sharing: Your sharing section is a bit confusing; you checked intellectual property rights as sharing restrictions, but no is answered under the last 3 subquestions of the first question (data), please explain the IP restrictions there, i.e. is this related to valorization potential, are there 3rd party agreements? You don't mention a data repository but answer yes under the PID question, note that PIDs are normally added by a data repository upon deposit of your dataset; a data repository also allows you to select a license and a license is not relevant when you are not sharing data openly, in that case a sharing agreement would be more suitable. For more information see https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-sharing and https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr
You also mention open access to publications, although that is not in the scope of a DMP and you can leave it out, note that you "must deposit the publications that result from the FWO subsidies in a repository (Lirias) and provide Open Access within one year from the date of publication" see: https://research.kuleuven.be/en/associatienet/output/open-access-fwo
